00095 class TiXmlBase
00096 {
00097     friend class TiXmlNode;
00098     friend class TiXmlElement;
00099     friend class TiXmlDocument;
00100 
00101 public:
00102     TiXmlBase()                             {}
00103     virtual ~TiXmlBase()                    {}
00104 
00110     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const = 0;
00111 
00118     static void SetCondenseWhiteSpace( bool condense )      { condenseWhiteSpace = condense; }
00119 
00121     static bool IsWhiteSpaceCondensed()                     { return condenseWhiteSpace; }
00122 
00123 protected:
00124 
00125     static const char*  SkipWhiteSpace( const char* );
00126     inline static bool  IsWhiteSpace( int c )       { return ( isspace( c ) || c == '\n' || c == '\r' ); }
00127 
00128     virtual void StreamOut (TIXML_OSTREAM *) const = 0;
00129 
00130     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00131         static bool StreamWhiteSpace( TIXML_ISTREAM * in, TIXML_STRING * tag );
00132         static bool StreamTo( TIXML_ISTREAM * in, int character, TIXML_STRING * tag );
00133     #endif
00134 
00135     /*  Reads an XML name into the string provided. Returns
00136         a pointer just past the last character of the name,
00137         or 0 if the function has an error.
00138     */
00139     static const char* ReadName( const char* p, TIXML_STRING* name );
00140 
00141     /*  Reads text. Returns a pointer past the given end tag.
00142         Wickedly complex options, but it keeps the (sensitive) code in one place.
00143     */
00144     static const char* ReadText(    const char* in,             // where to start
00145                                     TIXML_STRING* text,         // the string read
00146                                     bool ignoreWhiteSpace,      // whether to keep the white space
00147                                     const char* endTag,         // what ends this text
00148                                     bool ignoreCase );          // whether to ignore case in the end tag
00149     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p ) = 0;
00150 
00151     // If an entity has been found, transform it into a character.
00152     static const char* GetEntity( const char* in, char* value );
00153 
00154     // Get a character, while interpreting entities.
00155     inline static const char* GetChar( const char* p, char* value )
00156     {
00157         assert( p );
00158         if ( *p == '&' )
00159         {
00160             return GetEntity( p, value );
00161         }
00162         else
00163         {
00164             *value = *p;
00165             return p+1;
00166         }
00167     }
00168 
00169     // Puts a string to a stream, expanding entities as it goes.
00170     // Note this should not contian the '<', '>', etc, or they will be transformed into entities!
00171     static void PutString( const TIXML_STRING& str, TIXML_OSTREAM* out );
00172 
00173     static void PutString( const TIXML_STRING& str, TIXML_STRING* out );
00174 
00175     // Return true if the next characters in the stream are any of the endTag sequences.
00176     bool static StringEqual(    const char* p,
00177                                 const char* endTag,
00178                                 bool ignoreCase );
00179 
00180 
00181     enum
00182     {
00183         TIXML_NO_ERROR = 0,
00184         TIXML_ERROR,
00185         TIXML_ERROR_OPENING_FILE,
00186         TIXML_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY,
00187         TIXML_ERROR_PARSING_ELEMENT,
00188         TIXML_ERROR_FAILED_TO_READ_ELEMENT_NAME,
00189         TIXML_ERROR_READING_ELEMENT_VALUE,
00190         TIXML_ERROR_READING_ATTRIBUTES,
00191         TIXML_ERROR_PARSING_EMPTY,
00192         TIXML_ERROR_READING_END_TAG,
00193         TIXML_ERROR_PARSING_UNKNOWN,
00194         TIXML_ERROR_PARSING_COMMENT,
00195         TIXML_ERROR_PARSING_DECLARATION,
00196         TIXML_ERROR_DOCUMENT_EMPTY,
00197 
00198         TIXML_ERROR_STRING_COUNT
00199     };
00200     static const char* errorString[ TIXML_ERROR_STRING_COUNT ];
00201 
00202 private:
00203     struct Entity
00204     {
00205         const char*     str;
00206         unsigned int    strLength;
00207         char            chr;
00208     };
00209     enum
00210     {
00211         NUM_ENTITY = 5,
00212         MAX_ENTITY_LENGTH = 6
00213 
00214     };
00215     static Entity entity[ NUM_ENTITY ];
00216     static bool condenseWhiteSpace;
00217 };

00430     TiXmlDeclaration* ToDeclaration() const { return ( this && type == DECLARATION ) ? (TiXmlDeclaration*) this : 0; }

00449     TiXmlNode* Identify( const char* start );

00451                                                   target->userData = userData; }

00479 class TiXmlAttribute : public TiXmlBase
00480 {
00481     friend class TiXmlAttributeSet;
00482 
00483 public:
00485     TiXmlAttribute() : prev( 0 ), next( 0 ) {}
00486 
00487     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00488 
00489     TiXmlAttribute( const std::string& _name, const std::string& _value )
00490     {
00491         name = _name . c_str ();
00492         value = _value . c_str ();
00493     }
00494     #endif
00495 
00497     TiXmlAttribute( const char * _name, const char * _value ): name( _name ), value( _value ), prev( 0 ), next( 0 ) {}
00498     const char*     Name()  const       { return name.c_str (); }       
00499     const char*     Value() const       { return value.c_str (); }      
00500     const int       IntValue() const;                                   
00501     const double    DoubleValue() const;                                
00502 
00503     void SetName( const char* _name )   { name = _name; }               
00504     void SetValue( const char* _value ) { value = _value; }             
00505 
00506     void SetIntValue( int value );                                      
00507     void SetDoubleValue( double value );                                
00508 
00509     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00510     void SetName( const std::string& _name )    {   SetName (_name . c_str ()); }   
00511     void SetValue( const std::string& _value )  {   SetValue (_value . c_str ());   }   
00512     #endif
00513 
00515     TiXmlAttribute* Next() const;
00517     TiXmlAttribute* Previous() const;
00518 
00519     bool operator==( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs ) const { return rhs.name == name; }
00520     bool operator<( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs )  const { return name < rhs.name; }
00521     bool operator>( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs )  const { return name > rhs.name; }
00522 
00523     /*  [internal use]
00524         Attribtue parsing starts: first letter of the name
00525                          returns: the next char after the value end quote
00526     */
00527     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p );
00528 
00529     // [internal use]
00530     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const;
00531 
00532     virtual void StreamOut( TIXML_OSTREAM * out ) const;
00533     // [internal use]
00534     // Set the document pointer so the attribute can report errors.
00535     void SetDocument( TiXmlDocument* doc )  { document = doc; }
00536 
00537 private:
00538     TiXmlDocument*  document;   // A pointer back to a document, for error reporting.
00539     TIXML_STRING name;
00540     TIXML_STRING value;
00541     TiXmlAttribute* prev;
00542     TiXmlAttribute* next;
00543 };
00544 
00545 
00546 /*  A class used to manage a group of attributes.
00547     It is only used internally, both by the ELEMENT and the DECLARATION.
00548     
00549     The set can be changed transparent to the Element and Declaration
00550     classes that use it, but NOT transparent to the Attribute
00551     which has to implement a next() and previous() method. Which makes
00552     it a bit problematic and prevents the use of STL.
00553 
00554     This version is implemented with circular lists because:
00555         - I like circular lists
00556         - it demonstrates some independence from the (typical) doubly linked list.
00557 */
00558 class TiXmlAttributeSet
00559 {
00560 public:
00561     TiXmlAttributeSet();
00562     ~TiXmlAttributeSet();
00563 
00564     void Add( TiXmlAttribute* attribute );
00565     void Remove( TiXmlAttribute* attribute );
00566 
00567     TiXmlAttribute* First() const   { return ( sentinel.next == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.next; }
00568     TiXmlAttribute* Last()  const   { return ( sentinel.prev == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.prev; }
00569     TiXmlAttribute* Find( const char * name ) const;
00570 
00571 private:
00572     TiXmlAttribute sentinel;
00573 };
00574 
00575 
00580 class TiXmlElement : public TiXmlNode
00581 {
00582 public:
00584     TiXmlElement (const char * in_value);
00585 
00586     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00587 
00588     TiXmlElement( const std::string& _value ) :     TiXmlNode( TiXmlNode::ELEMENT )
00589     {
00590         firstChild = lastChild = 0;
00591         value = _value . c_str ();
00592     }
00593     #endif
00594 
00595     virtual ~TiXmlElement();
00596 
00600     const char * Attribute( const char * name ) const;
00601 
00605     const char * Attribute( const char * name, int & i ) const;
00606 
00610     void SetAttribute( const char * name, const char * value );
00611 
00612     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00613     void SetAttribute( const std::string& name, const std::string& value )  {   SetAttribute (name . c_str (), value . c_str ());   }   
00614     void SetAttribute( const std::string& name, int value ) {   SetAttribute (name . c_str (), value);  }   
00615     #endif
00616 
00620     void SetAttribute( const char * name, int value );
00621 
00624     void RemoveAttribute( const char * name );
00625     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00626     void RemoveAttribute( const std::string& name ) {   RemoveAttribute (name . c_str ());  }   
00627     #endif
00628 
00629     TiXmlAttribute* FirstAttribute() const  { return attributeSet.First(); }        
00630     TiXmlAttribute* LastAttribute() const   { return attributeSet.Last(); }     
00631 
00632     // [internal use] Creates a new Element and returs it.
00633     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;
00634     // [internal use]
00635 
00636     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const;
00637 
00638 protected:
00639 
00640     // Used to be public [internal use]
00641     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00642         virtual void StreamIn( TIXML_ISTREAM * in, TIXML_STRING * tag );
00643     #endif
00644     virtual void StreamOut( TIXML_OSTREAM * out ) const;
00645 
00646     /*  [internal use]
00647         Attribtue parsing starts: next char past '<'
00648                          returns: next char past '>'
00649     */
00650     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p );
00651 
00652     /*  [internal use]
00653         Reads the "value" of the element -- another element, or text.
00654         This should terminate with the current end tag.
00655     */
00656     const char* ReadValue( const char* in );
00657 
00658 private:
00659     TiXmlAttributeSet attributeSet;
00660 };

00680     #endif

00708     }
00709     #endif

00716     virtual void StreamOut ( TIXML_OSTREAM * out ) const;
00717     // [internal use]
00718     bool Blank() const; // returns true if all white space and new lines
00719     /*  [internal use]
00720             Attribtue parsing starts: First char of the text
00721                              returns: next char past '>'
00722         */
00723     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p );
00724     // [internal use]
00725     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00726         virtual void StreamIn( TIXML_ISTREAM * in, TIXML_STRING * tag );
00727     #endif

00835 class TiXmlDocument : public TiXmlNode
00836 {
00837 public:
00839     TiXmlDocument();
00841     TiXmlDocument( const char * documentName );
00842 
00843     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00844 
00845     TiXmlDocument( const std::string& documentName ) :
00846         TiXmlNode( TiXmlNode::DOCUMENT )
00847     {
00848         value = documentName;
00849         error = false;
00850     }
00851     #endif
00852 
00853     virtual ~TiXmlDocument() {}
00854 
00859     bool LoadFile();
00861     bool SaveFile() const;
00863     bool LoadFile( const char * filename );
00865     bool SaveFile( const char * filename ) const;
00866 
00867     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00868     bool LoadFile( const std::string& filename )            
00869     {
00870         return LoadFile (filename.c_str ());
00871     }
00872     bool SaveFile( const std::string& filename ) const      
00873     {
00874         return SaveFile (filename.c_str ());
00875     }
00876     #endif
00877 
00879     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p );
00880 
00885     TiXmlElement* RootElement() const       { return FirstChildElement(); }
00886 
00888     bool Error() const                      { return error; }
00889 
00891     const char * ErrorDesc() const  { return errorDesc . c_str (); }
00892 
00896     const int ErrorId() const               { return errorId; }
00897 
00899     void ClearError()                       { error = false; errorId = 0; errorDesc = ""; }
00900 
00902     void Print() const                              { Print( stdout, 0 ); }
00903 
00904     // [internal use]
00905     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth = 0 ) const;
00906     // [internal use]
00907     void SetError( int err ) {      assert( err > 0 && err < TIXML_ERROR_STRING_COUNT );
00908         error   = true;
00909         errorId = err;
00910     errorDesc = errorString[ errorId ]; }
00911

00913     virtual void StreamOut ( TIXML_OSTREAM * out) const;
00914     // [internal use]

00917         virtual void StreamIn( TIXML_ISTREAM * in, TIXML_STRING * tag );
00918     #endif
